qas.question: What are the names of two researchers who divided neolithic chronology into ten periods?
What traits did researchers use to divide the ten periods?
When was the original division of 10 advanced to a division of 5?
What are the names of two researchers who divided neolithic chronology into five periods?
What are the names of two researchers who divided neolithic chronology into nine periods?
What traits did researchers use to divide the nine periods?
When was the original division of 9 advanced to a division of 5?
What are the names of two researchers who divided neolithic chronology in to four periods?
Who advanced the idea of a final stage between the PPNA and PPNB?

context: In 1981 a team of researchers from the Maison de l'Orient et de la Méditerranée, including <a0_0><b4_0>Jacques Cauvin and Oliver Aurenche<b4_0/><a0_0/> divided Near East neolithic chronology into ten periods (0 to 9) based on <a1_0><b5_0>social, economic and cultural characteristics<b5_0/><a1_0/>. In <a2_0><b6_0>2002<b6_0/><a2_0/> <a3_0><b7_0><b8_0>Danielle Stordeur and Frédéric Abbès<b8_0/><b7_0/><a3_0/> advanced this system with a division into five periods. Natufian (1) between 12,000 and 10,200 BC, Khiamian (2) between 10,200-8,800 BC, PPNA: Sultanian (Jericho), Mureybetian, early PPNB (PPNB ancien) (3) between 8,800-7,600 BC, middle PPNB (PPNB moyen) 7,600-6,900 BC, late PPNB (PPNB récent) (4) between 7,500 and 7,000 BC and a PPNB (sometimes called PPNC) transitional stage (PPNB final) (5) where Halaf and dark faced burnished ware begin to emerge between 6,900-6,400 BC. They also advanced the idea of a transitional stage between the PPNA and PPNB between 8,800 and 8,600 BC at sites like Jerf el Ahmar and Tell Aswad.
